thread.title: David Bowie to be honoured with Royal Mail stamp collection
thread.title_full: David Bowie to be honoured with Royal Mail stamp collection

author: Jessica Burrell
title: David Bowie to be honoured with Royal Mail stamp collection
text:
David Bowie to be honoured with Royal Mail stamp collection 
A set of 10 stamps will be issued in tribute to the legendary musician Wednesday 25 January 2017 17:31 BST Click to follow See the David Bowie tribute stamp collection from Royal Mail 1/12 
Some of the special stamps Royal Mail are issuing as a tribute to David Bowie, featuring a selection of album covers Royal Mail 
Stamp featuring the Aladdin Sane album cover, which was released in 1973 Royal Mail 
Stamp featuring the "Heroes" album cover Royal Mail 
A Reality Tour, 2004 - David Bowie tribute stamp Royal Mail 
The Ziggy Stardust Tour, 1973 - David Bowie tribute stamp Royal Mail 
The Serious Moonlight Tour, 1983 - David Bowie tribute stamp Royal Mail 
The Stage Tour, 1978 - David Bowie tribute stamp Royal Mail 
Stamp featuring the Let's Dance album, released in 1983 Royal Mail 
Blackstar album cover stamp, Bowie's 25th and final studio album Royal Mail 
Tribute stamp featuring the Earthling album cover, released in 1997 Royal Mail 
Hunky Dory album cover stamp, celebrating Bowie's 4th studio album released in 1971 Royal Mail 
Four stamps featuring images of Bowie performing live throughout the decades Royal Mail 
In the year that would have marked his 70 th birthday, Royal Mail is issuing a set of 10 stamps to honour David Bowie . 
This is the first time Royal Mail has dedicated an entire stamp collection to an individual cultural figure - and Bowie seems a fitting choice as one of the most influential musicians of all time. 
Six of the stamps will feature Bowie’s most famous album covers – including Aladdin Sane, “Heroes” and Let’s Dance – simultaneously showcasing his changing musical styles and personas. 
The four other stamps will carry images of the musician performing live on tours that spanned four decades, from The Ziggy Stardust Tour in 1972 to the A Reality Tour in 2004. Where to celebrate David Bowie's 70th in London 
Having inspired generations of artists and fans alike before his untimely death, these special stamps commemorate Bowie as the pioneering icon he was. 
Stamps can be pre-ordered today and will be on sale from March 14 here and in 7,000 Post Office branches across the UK. 
Follow us on Twitter @eslifeandstyle and Instagram @standard.lifestyle More about:
